quotes.quote: You learn how to be a gracious winner and an outstanding loser.
There are always new, grander challenges to confront, and a true winner will embrace each one.
My teacher once told me. No one is perfect that is why pencils have erasers.
A winner is someone who recognizes his God-given talents, works his tail off to develop them into skills, and uses these skills to accomplish his goals
I hated every minute of training, but I said, Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
Lucky people get opportunities; brave people create opportunities; and winners are those that convert problems into opportunities.
It's not whether you win or lose, it's how you play the game.
I'm a winner, I play to win, I want to make good things go on around me.
Self-praise is for losers. Be a winner. Stand for something. Always have class, and be humble.
I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
You're not obligated to win. You're obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.
A champion needs a motivation above and beyond winning.
Winners are naturally bullish.
Winning isn't everything but wanting to win is.
If you want to find the real competition, just look in the mirror. After awhile you'll see your rivals scrambling for second place.
It's easy to win. Anybody can win.
You can't be a winner and be afraid to lose.
When you win, say nothing. When you lose, say less.
Winning is the most important thing in my life, after breathing. Breathing first, winning next.
Winners make a habit of manufacturing their own positive expectations in advance of the event.
Winning isn't everything, it's the only thing.
A winner never stops trying.
Winners know they are not perpect. They respect their weaknesses while making the most of their strenghts.
If you aren't getting rejected on a daily basis, then your goals aren't ambitious enough.
Show me a gracious loser and I'll show you a failure.
If you even dream of beating me, you'd better wake up and apologize
It's easy to have faith in yourself and have discipline when you're a winner, when you're number one. What you got to have is faith and discipline when you're not a winner.
Losing feels worse than winning feels good.
The key is not the will to win everybody has that. It is the will to prepare to win that is important.
Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.
